se.cbb.jprime.mcmc

Class MultiProposerSelector

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.cbb.jprime.mcmc.MultiProposerSelector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InfoProvider, ProposerSelector

    public class MultiProposerSelector
extends java.lang.Object
implements ProposerSelector
    Selects one or more proposers (acting on disjoint state parameters). The user may specify a desired weight set for how often more than one proposer should be attempted to be invoked, e.g. [0.60,0.30,0.10] for 1 proposer 60% of the time, 2 proposers 30% of the time and 3 proposers 10% of the time. However, there is no guarantee that exactly these numbers will be achieved in practice (due to that they may act on the same parameters).
    Author:
    Joel Sj√∂strand.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MultiProposerSelector

        public MultiProposerSelector(PRNG prng)
        Creates an instance where only one proposer at a time is invoked.
        Parameters:
        prng - the PRNG used for random selection.

      • MultiProposerSelector

        public MultiProposerSelector(PRNG prng,
                     double[] noWeights)
        Creates an instance where more than one proposer may be selected. The number of proposers attempted is specified in a weight array where element 0 corresponds to 1 proposer and so forth.
        Parameters:
        prng - the PRNG used for random selection.
        noWeights - the desired weights for the number of selected proposers, e.g. [0.5,0.5] for 1 proposer 50% of the time and 2 proposers 50% of the time.

      • getDisjointProposers

        public java.util.Set<Proposer> getDisjointProposers()
        Description copied from interface: ProposerSelector
        Selects a subset of a list of proposers which can then be used for actual perturbations. It is up to implementing classes to decide whether they e.g. return only a single object or multiple objects. Furthermore, the returned proposers must be guaranteed to be acting on disjoint sets of state parameters.
        Specified by:
        getDisjointProposers in interface ProposerSelector
        Returns:
        a subset of proposers, no pairs acting on the same state parameter.
